intro: Psychotria tacpo, commonly known as the "Cocaine Plant," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly the Amazon basin. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green. It produces a milky latex sap that contains various alkaloids, including cocaine. Due to its psychoactive properties, it has significant ecological and legal implications in its native habitat.
